#### Definition

Let ${\{a_n\}}_{n=0}^\infty$ be a sequence of real (or possibly complex
numbers). The [**Cesàro mean**]{} of the sequence $\{a_n\}$ is the
sequence $\{b_n\}_{n=0}^\infty$ with
$$b_n = \frac{1}{n+1} \sum_{i=0}^{n} a_i.$$

### Properties

1.  A key property of the Cesàro mean is that it has the same limit as
    the original sequence (when this limit exists). In other words, if
    $\{a_n\}$ and $\{b_n\}$ are as above, and $a_n \to a$, then
    $b_n \to a$. In particular, if $\{a_n\}$ converges, then $\{b_n\}$
    converges too.
